origin: Aberdeen and Angus Counties of Scotland
description: Polled (hornless), moderate frame size, excellent meat quality (nice marbling), and calving ease.
Polled (honless), moderate frame size, disease resistant, heat resistant, and hardiness.
Horned or polled (hornless), medium to large frame size, heavily muscled, excellent growth rate, good feed conversion, and late maturity.
Short horned or polled (hornless), excellent growth rate, good muscling, early puberty, amd calving ease.

color: Rust brown to deep rich red body with white on the face, crest, dewlap, underline, switch, and legs below the knee.
description: Horns that typically curve down beside the head, moderate frame size, broad head, good foraging ability, docile, and good fertility.

origin: Limousin and Macho regions of France
color: Yellow straw to reddish gold with lighter circles around eyes and muzzle.
description: Horns or polled (hornless), medium to large frame size, long bodied, small head, heavily muscled, high carcass yield, good growth rate, and good feed efficiency.
Polled (hornless), moderate frame size, excellent meat quality (nicely marbled), calving ease, and hardy.

color: Deep cherry red to reddish brown.
description: Horned or polled (hornless), moderate frame size, heat and tick resistant, calving ease, mothering ability and good milk supply.

color: Yellowish brown to straw to dark red with white markings on the head, brisket, belly, and lower parts of the legs.
description: Horned or polled (hornless), large frame size, long and deep bodied, heavily muscled, high carcass yield, good growth rate, good feed efficiency, and good milk production.

color: Vary in color from light red to reddish brown.
description: Horned or polled (hornless), moderate frame size, good milking ability, and calving ease.
